summary_gpt: V-Guard Industries Ltd. announced a board meeting scheduled for May 14, 2025, to review and approve financial results for Q4 and FY 2025, and to consider recommending a final dividend for FY 2024-25. The company also informed about the trading window closure following SEBI regulations.

V-Guard Industries received two GST demand orders from the Commercial Tax Officer in Coimbatore, related to non-generation of e-waybills for credit notes issued in FY 2021-22 and FY 2022-23, amounting to approximately ₹52.39 lakh and ₹72 lakh respectively. The company is currently evaluating the next steps to address these tax demands.

V-Guard Industries received two GST demand orders from the Tamil Nadu Commercial Tax Department related to non-generation of e-waybills for credit notes issued in FY 2019-20 and 2020-21, amounting to approximately ₹72.3 lakh and ₹44.75 lakh respectively. The company has disclosed this compliance update to the stock exchanges as per SEBI regulations.
